intro: Buchnera capitata, commonly known as the crown bugle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. Buchnera capitata is often found in moist, woodland habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
